D04936482E984C9896CBD2DCBA29F13C.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements related to hospitality and tourism (e.g., Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan and Transition Plan, certificates, reports, photographs, recipe catalogue), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

A020D20159A64DBCB06CBFF35BC22D56.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the food and beverage services sector, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., teamwork, reliability, customer service);

D442064140294598BEAA4BD94DC8763B.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the food and beverage services sector, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., scheduling or budgeting and accounting, measurement and calculation, job task planning and organizing);

24AB30C605D949289DC2B71909BC18FA.description: identify the provincial and national associations that support the activities of the tourism industry and provide career-related resources (e.g., Ontario Tourism Education Corporation [OTEC], Ontario Restaurant Hotel and Motel Association, Canadian Tourism Human Resource Council, Canadian Restaurant and Foodservices Association, Ontario Society of Nutrition Management, Canadian Culinary Federation, Meeting Professionals International);

5BFC0AD4B10949A1BB41DF06BED43205.description: identify industry-recognized training and/or certifications (e.g., Service Excellence, Super Host, Safe Food Handling, Smart Serve) that it would be beneficial to have if they are pursuing a career in the food and beverage services sector;

A41E1BCFC0D846528CB597B8BD100CA0.description: identify industry-recognized training and/or certifications (e.g., Service Excellence, Super Host, Safe Food Handling, Smart Serve) that it would be beneficial to have if they are pursuing a career in the food and beverage services sector;

007F9F412B674123BA5A00914E169B66.description: describe the lifestyle and personal choices that can accompany a career in the food and beverage services sector (e.g., shift work, seasonal work, travel);

F6A46211BB144906AFE3192D808E82D6.description: outline job opportunities, career paths, and educational requirements for careers in the food and beverage services sector of the tourism industry;

2ED9FC6F9B834C75B01C09D3E81E876E.description: Career Opportunities: describe the range of career opportunities and the education and training required for employment in the food and beverage services sector of the tourism industry

8811FC50DBDD449FA644C88F25098C7F.description: demonstrate an understanding of the use of ethical standards in customer service (e.g., standards relating to privacy, confidentiality, and business ethics).

47BEE164E24D458F943EFF1AF10FCB45.description: assess various strategies used by companies to retain and grow their customer base (e.g., providing a unique environment or service, offering customers a points-accumulation system and/or prizes, holding customer appreciation days);

CBCE321FC05748A1AFDD1C56940836A3.description: explain the need for sensitivity in responding to client needs (e.g., explain why knowledge of and respect for various cultures, religions, and people with disabilities are important in providing customer service);

1157322C931143398EC831299F9CD8EE.description: outline the benefits of providing a positive customer experience (e.g., reputation of the business enhanced, customer base maintained or expanded, viability of the business increased);

9771E0E3A3984A58BABCBBF15EC6835E.description: apply intrapersonal and interpersonal skills to provide a professional level of customer service;

72F1B61DE826434E9E44DFC045D548E0.description: Customer Service: demonstrate an understanding of strategies and techniques that provide a positive customer service experience;

E04CB731DC9D4BD897C39733E837560C.description: use protective clothing and equipment as required to ensure their own and others' safety in the work environment.

1A23D3E1A906448DAC9BB9FC9212F63F.description: demonstrate the ability to follow health and safety best practices (e.g., report unsafe working conditions in the school classroom/facility; use WHMIS data sheets and understand WHMIS safety cautions; know appropriate first aid procedures to be used in the event of an accident such as a burn, cut, or electric shock);

09151658CB444A0096D5B45CB44DB9EF.description: identify ways of meeting health and safety requirements and recommendations (e.g., concerning public safety) in various settings of the food and beverage services sector (e.g., carry out food inspections; have an emergency preparedness fire/evacuation plan; maintain a clean, hygienic facility; provide separate washrooms for staff and customers; observe municipal by-laws);

4F5A55C5DA3844809307873810BD0F26.description: identify and describe health and safety issues that must be considered in workplaces in the food and beverage services sector (e.g., issues concerning trip and fall, exposure to chemicals, the effects of fatigue, and workplace ergonomics), and explain how these issues affect working conditions;

FA0D4C3DF6BB4832AD15F26F15BA845F.description: describe the laws, regulations, and regulatory/ oversight organizations that govern health, safety, sanitation, and workers' rights in the food and beverage services sector of the tourism industry (e.g., Health Protection and Promotion Act [HPPA], Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS] regulations, Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB], local health departments);

E73521FC95AF4728BEBE4CFE95F56BBF.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and compliance with health and safety legislation and regulations and the practices that are essential for a safe and healthy work environment;

64C75B78259945D8A5BE41CD297287EF.description: describe how tourism can affect the culture of a society (e.g., tourist attitudes and behaviour can over time erode local customs and traditions and/or cause resentment among the local population).

77EBFB796A8A45F58FCEE6E8A843058E.description: explain how food and beverage services facilities benefit the local job market (e.g., by creating a range of entry-level jobs, providing experiential learning opportunities in hospitality and tourism-related businesses, having a ripple effect on other areas of the job market);

3798D73AA48748D193E79BD86E8E4879.description: explain the importance of the tourism industry at the local level (e.g., tourism can support local economies, create local jobs, preserve local culture, and/or provide funds for infrastructure development and social and recreational programs);

9B4A9EF8173848A99CFE521B21AA5EAE.description: identify ways in which the food and beverage services sector could offset its impact on the environment (e.g., develop or support a tree planting program, develop or contribute to a carbon offset fund).

EFB518BA5E3C4E58BE0A3BD425F859C8.description: identify, through research, an appropriate code of ethics and/or guidelines for sustainable tourism and describe how they could be applied to the operation of local food and beverage services facilities;

5F14C4A0A18546A78BA0E7A689D17EF1.description: describe how the food and beverage services sector can both protect the environment and encourage the sustainable use of natural resources (e.g., by choosing new locations on or near existing infrastructure to reduce the need for new infrastructure, providing guests with the option not to have linens washed daily, composting organic waste from restaurants, reusing cooking oil as a biofuel, using locally grown produce to reduce the need for long-distance transportation);

3370F56AC6344658A9DC38BF09114DC0.description: identify the effects that the tourism industry has on the environment (e.g., undeveloped areas exploited for commercial gain, environmentally sensitive areas affected by pollution and waste disposal, infrastructure expanded and upgraded, areas of natural beauty preserved as tourist attractions);

BD5B503E8383432AA86677A1C75ADE21.description: Industry Practices, The Environment, and Society

2CD7374CDFA8439098A6B851527EF1C7.description: analyse the success of an event or activity in relation to its action plan (e.g., have a formal debriefing using a plus/delta format).

F81020904D6E45FD9CE543469570AF2C.description: use teamwork and organizational skills to complete a variety of tasks in the coordination and/or staging of an event or activity;

7898EDA92ECF4BB29A185AFD7AF155E0.description: coordinate and stage an event or activity individually or as part of a team;

EDB7C6ECA33148C193E0B9C913942308.description: design, plan, and promote an activity or fundraiser, individually or as part of a team, using a variety of software applications;

72B5A36491C648E3B50E0B59F7A2F2A0.description: create an action plan for an event or activity and outline the designated role of each participant in the staging of the event or activity;

13187FEEBCBB45E38AABA90395F8C140.description: Planning and Delivering an Event or Activity: demonstrate an understanding of appropriate procedures to follow in the planning and delivery of an event or activity.

E291484761D14BC69DE399DE2B55292A.description: demonstrate the use of professional waiting techniques when serving beverages (e.g., taking and delivering orders, providing tea and coffee service, serving and clearing from the right).

3FDE3555D2964D6CB149F08EDB9F90ED.description: set a table in a professional and creative manner (e.g., paying attention to the choice and arrangement of utensils and glassware, the design of the centrepiece, the way napkins are folded) to suit the circumstances (e.g., fine dining, wedding, banquet);

81F2E1383D7D4F93B62E500E3938FE22.description: present food products appropriately for a variety of purposes (e.g., buffet, à la carte);

5A2E89F7DAB6408A805EA50F881073B6.description: prepare complex recipes accurately using readily available ingredients;

95CEBE5E2CCC44E0A716F0B1D0CBBC09.description: prepare a variety of international recipes in accordance with the culinary traditions of various cultures (e.g., Aboriginal, Thai, French, Italian);

D86D5D88FD5D4CF78EC535767038EDF5.description: prepare a variety of food products (e.g., appetizer, main course, dessert, hot and cold beverages) according to recipe specifications;

B5B2C89590D84CBBB4DB0676BABF02B5.description: perform accurate calculations of yield as it relates to “as raw product purchased” and “edible portion”, and explain how the relationship between the two calculations affects cost and profitability;

8A3E221DB2714A239B1D1E2584A2E013.description: perform accurate conversions and calculations of yield (i.e., the number of persons who can be served) for various types of recipes, using metric, US customary, or British imperial units as appropriate;

8A62CFCA106442CA82576C7F3C7C2A91.description: apply Health Protection and Promotion Act (HPPA) standards in handling, storing, and preparing food products (e.g., cook and/or store food at the proper tempurature; apply the "first in, first out"[FIFO] method in selecting ingredients);

50FB0AAD628B445D84254BF035C330E8.description: Food Preparation and Presentation: plan and prepare menus, demonstrating a level of competence in food handling, preparation, and presentation that meets professional standards;

1087F29250204B229BCA5EC497B079E3.description: maintain tools and equipment related to the food and beverage services sector in a professional manner (e.g., keep knives sharp, keep workstations clean and organized, store tools properly).

B5D96E2CB26C48D1BF72FAD5B2763825.description: use a variety of measuring tools to accurately determine, in metric, US customary, or British imperial units as appropriate, the weight and/or volume of ingredients for meal preparation and, in degrees Celsius or Fahrenheit, the cooking temperature required;

547634A3D393451FBD1264E180FA1959.description: demonstrate proficiency when using a variety of tools and equipment related to the food and beverage services sector (e.g., electric mixers, ovens, knives);

F558CE1D0F2C4918AEDE3A2369E1BA4E.description: Using Tools and Equipment: demonstrate technical proficiency in the use and maintenance of tools and equipment related to the food and beverage services sector of the tourism industry.

7917BE109A3049A2989CC41C811C1944.description: describe how various types of equipment are used in the food and beverage services sector (e.g., barbecues for grilling food outdoors, insulated carriers for transporting frozen food, chafing dishes for keeping food warm at a buffet).

F16CE6A44931456BAC1B135844B650A4.description: list the main types of equipment needed to operate different types of food service operations (e.g., quick-service outlet, diner, restaurant, banquet hall);

0229E119007B4F68816D13F7EDC40582.description: describe ways in which the food and beverage services sector can take advantage of community facilities to host an activity or event (e.g., catering a banquet at the local arena, holding receptions at a community centre);

E9FDA5441DC041B2895ED9064DA90B04.description: identify the characteristics of various types of facilities (e.g., health spa, hotel, resort, bed and breakfast operation, country club) that include food and beverage services as part of the services they provide;

001519D2411A45029A2D9EC6403A3095.description: Facilities and Equipment: demonstrate an understanding of various types of facilities and equipment used in the food and beverage services sector of the tourism industry.

F822B42795F24746BED8A97BD9C15E63.description: identify the causes of food-borne illnesses (e.g., salmonella, Norwalk virus, E. coli), the associated medical symptoms (e.g., nausea, stomach cramps, fever), and methods of prevention (e.g., store, handle, and cook food appropriately).

F7312607E7FC49E3A8370C79EBD80A87.description: demonstrate effective management of resources and inventory (e.g., in terms of portion control, waste management, and energy conservation);

7408698FE0814B4B801846EB4E5A3C6F.description: demonstrate professional food storage practices (e.g., label containers; apply the "first in, first out" method when selecting food products for use);

337F7E2D556840BC81B0AA4D4737D73E.description: apply provincial standards for safe food handling when preparing food (e.g., wear gloves, use different-coloured cutting boards for different foods);

F7498AB628884C8CB4830F5B6E74F8BF.description: demonstrate the use of safe food handling and proper sanitation practices (e.g., prevent cross-contamination of foods, keep their person and uniform clean, wear hair nets, observe good housekeeping practices);

7160D1E061D34C138812D0ACED692FA7.description: Food Handling and Storage: handle and store foods in compliance with the Health Protection and Promotion Act (HPPA);

D6E08C706B4945ABA672D1C47EFEE318.description: explain why dietary supplements are added in the production of various foods (e.g., to supply nutrients [vitamins, minerals, fatty acids, amino acids] that are missing from or not consumed in sufficient quantities in a person's diet).

CDF73E508B234477AD952AF655774B76.description: create a meal plan that incorporates the essential principles of nutrition and explain how it provides a nutritious, well-balanced diet;

9A30450A0D524585B0A190F605DDC6D2.description: identify ways in which lifestyle, health, and age affect a person's dietary and nutritional needs (e.g., lifestyle: people who are not physically active need fewer calories than those who exercise regularly; health: diabetics require a diet that is low in sugar and carbohydrates to keep their bloodsugar level in balance; age: women as they age require calcium supplements to combat osteoporosis)

00533F61414948CD9D19AC595076DE47.description: identify the differences (e.g., with respect to yield, nutrition, freshness, taste) between locally grown and/or organically grown fruits and vegetables and those grown using traditional cultivation techniques (e.g., use of fertilizer and pesticides) and/or harvested unripe and transported long distances;

62DA55B5E1FA4EC5A088427326A24C0E.description: describe the effect of food-processing techniques (e.g., freezing, pickling, grinding, thawing) on the nutritional value of food;

2F566ADEDC724F3FAA28DB919BA1D0A7.description: identify various food products and cuisines from around the world and assess the nutritional value of various popular dishes using appropriate resources (e.g., Eating Well with Canada’s Food Guide [2007]; Eating Well with Canada’s Food Guide: First Nations, Inuit and Métis; cultural adaptations of Canada’s Food Guide available from the Ontario Public Health Association);

9C1C2C88498347C8BBDD33557FD971F9.description: describe the essential principles of nutrition as referenced in Canada’s Food Guide and accompanying resources (e.g., Eating Well with Canada’s Food Guide [2007]; Eating Well with Canada’s Food Guide: First Nations, Inuit and Métis; cultural adaptations of Canada’s Food Guide available from the Ontario Public Health Association);

68D28B567DAE4AF6A8AA4AD262D6A172.description: Planning Nutritious Meals: explain the importance and value of a well-balanced and nutritious meal plan;

2EB586053894496A9251F8D2F48C496C.description: identify and describe factors that contribute to the success of businesses in the food and beverage services sector (e.g., attractive or convenient location, good-quality products at competitive prices, prompt and attentive service, relaxing atmosphere)

D882B3693B4E44CD94F8DAADAB79BE50.description: describe important considerations for food and beverage servers when delivering room service professionally to guests in hotels and other lodging properties (e.g., food and/or beverages are at the appropriate temperature; delivery is timely; presentation of food and/or beverages is appropriate);

6DDB867DE7614379B09DD89ACA1670FE.description: describe how tourist attractions benefit the local and/or provincial food and beverage services sector (e.g., areas close to museums, theatres, and scenic attractions are good locations for restaurants, cafés, and bars);

46BF9E70285C4CBEA0E56630BC943995.description: identify and describe factors that contribute to the growth of the tourism industry (e.g., development and improvement of tourist facilities, technological advances such as Internet reservation systems, favourable exchange rates, an increase in disposable income, the expansion of a middle class in developing countries, the promotion of international festivals and sporting events);

C7BB4CA6DCBB4B03A222F472A9EDB559.description: Factors Affecting the Tourism A2. Planning Nutritious Meals Industry: demonstrate an understanding of factors that affect the tourism industry in general and the food and beverage services sector specifically;
